intro: Senecio dacicus, commonly known as the Cape Verde senecio, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs, aiding in water retention. Senecio dacicus produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
